dk.statsbiblioteket.util.xml
Class DOM

java.lang.Object
  dk.statsbiblioteket.util.xml.DOM

@QAInfo(level=NORMAL,
        state=IN_DEVELOPMENT,
        author="te, mke")
public class DOM
extends java.lang.Object

Helpers for doing DOM parsing and manipulations. The methods are thread-safe and allows for parallel execution of the same xpath.

stringToDOM

public static org.w3c.dom.Document stringToDOM(java.lang.String xmlString,
                                               boolean namespaceAware)
Parses an XML document from a String to a DOM.

Parameters:
xmlString - a String containing an XML document.
namespaceAware - if true the parsed DOM will reflect any XML namespaces declared in the document
Returns:
The document in a DOM or null on errors.

Returns:
The document in a DOM or null on errors.

                                               boolean namespaceAware)
Parses a XML document from a stream to a DOM or return null on error.

Parameters:
xmlStream - a stream containing an XML document.
namespaceAware - if true the constructed DOM will reflect the namespaces declared in the XML document
Returns:
The document in a DOM or null in case of errors

streamToDOM

Parses a XML document from a stream to a DOM disregarding namespaces. Returns null on error.

Parameters:
xmlStream - a stream containing an XML document.
Returns:
The document in a DOM or null in case of errors

                                    throws javax.xml.transform.TransformerException

Parameters:
dom - the Document to convert.
withXmlDeclaration - if trye, an XML-declaration is prepended.
Returns:
the dom as an XML String.
Throws:
javax.xml.transform.TransformerException - if the dom could not be converted.

createXPathSelector

public static XPathSelector createXPathSelector(java.lang.String... nsContext)
Create a new XPathSelector instance with a given namespace mapping. The arguments are parsed as prefix1, uri1, prefix2, uri2, ....

If you want to apply XPath expressions without namespaces use the static select* methods directly on the DOM class.

Note that if you want to apply XPath selections on a DOM constructed from either streamToDOM(InputStream, boolean) or stringToDOM(String, boolean) you must pass namespaceAware=true as the boolean argument. Namespaced selections will fail on a DOM constructed without namespaces.

Parameters:
nsContext - prefix, uri pairs
Returns:
a newly allocated XPathSelector
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if an uneven number of arguments are passed

selectInteger

public static java.lang.Integer selectInteger(org.w3c.dom.Node node,
                                              java.lang.String xpath,
                                              java.lang.Integer defaultValue)
Extract an integer value from node or return defaultValue if it is not found.

Parameters:
node - the node with the wanted attribute.
xpath - the XPath to extract.
defaultValue - the default value.
Returns:
the value of the path, if existing, else defaultValue

selectString

public static java.lang.String selectString(org.w3c.dom.Node node,
                                            java.lang.String xpath,
                                            java.lang.String defaultValue)
Extract the given value from the node as a String or if the value cannot be extracted, defaultValue is returned.

Example: To get the value of the attribute "foo" in the node, specify "@foo" as the path.

Note: This method does not handle namespaces explicitely.

Parameters:
node - the node with the wanted attribute
xpath - the XPath to extract.
defaultValue - the default value
Returns:
the value of the path, if existing, else defaultValue

selectString

public static java.lang.String selectString(org.w3c.dom.Node node,
                                            java.lang.String xpath)
Extract the given value from the node as a String or if the value cannot be extracted, the empty string is returned

Example: To get the value of the attribute "foo" in the node, specify "@foo" as the path.

Note: This method does not handle namespaces explicitely.

Parameters:
node - the node with the wanted attribute
xpath - the XPath to extract
Returns:
the value of the path, if existing, else the empty string

selectNodeList

public static org.w3c.dom.NodeList selectNodeList(org.w3c.dom.Node node,
                                                  java.lang.String xpath)
Select the NodeList with the given XPath.

Note: This is a convenience method that logs exceptions instead of throwing them.

Parameters:
node - the root document.
xpath - the xpath for the Node list.
Returns:
the NodeList requested or an empty NodeList if unattainable

selectNode

public static org.w3c.dom.Node selectNode(org.w3c.dom.Node dom,
                                          java.lang.String xpath)
Select the Node with the given XPath.

Note: This is a convenience method that logs exceptions instead of throwing them.

Parameters:
dom - the root document.
xpath - the xpath for the node.
Returns:
the Node or null if unattainable.
